description: ## Non-cargo/tanker Ship density Map This indicator shows maps representing the total ship presence time on a 1 km grid (EEA/Inspire standards) for every month from 2017-2021. The indicator is provided by the [EMODnet Human activities portal](https://www.emodnet-humanactivities.eu/view-data.php). Ship categories do not include tanker and cargo ships. The total ship presence times are converted to average instantaneous number of ships per square km. These maps have been made from ship reporting data of the Automatic Identification System (AIS), collected by coastal stations and satellites. EMODnet Human Activities creates vessel density maps of EU waters showing the average number of vessels of certain type (cargo, passenger, fishing etc.) in a given period within a grid cell.

links.title: Vessel density for non tanker or cargo

subtitle: Vessel density for non tanker or cargo vessels
shortdescription: This indicator shows how many non-cargo and non-tanker ships (such as passenger ferries, fishing vessels, or recreational boats) were active in European waters each month. It uses AIS signals, which are location messages that all large ships send out (similar to a tracking system). By mapping where these vessels were over time from 2017 to 2021, it helps people understand how everyday maritime activities changed, including during the COVID-19 pandemic, and how they contribute to coastal life, tourism, and local economies.
title: Vessel density for non tanker or cargo
